snippet: Owners say stringent new standards could result in fewer than 10 abortion clinics across a sprawling state.
abstract: Abortion providers in Texas press judge to block portions of new state law that requires all abortion facilities to be licensed as ambulatory surgery centers; say new standards, set to take effect on Sept 1, could result in fewer than 10 abortion clinics in all of Texas.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and ERIK ECKHOLM
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Austin, and Erik Eckholm from New York.

lead_paragraph: Owners say stringent new standards could result in fewer than 10 abortion clinics across a sprawling state.

headline.main: Abortion Providers in Texas Press Judge to Block Portions of New Law
headline.print_headline: Abortion Providers in Texas Press Judge to Block Portions of New Law
